# Government Tender Announcement

## Stage 1 Trans-Canada Highway 1 Pavement Restoration – Glacier National Park
### Reference Number: PW-23-01030006
### Solicitation Number: 5P468-23-0018/A
### Tender Status: Expired

## Introduction
Parks Canada invites contractors to participate in a two-phase selection process for the Stage 1 Trans-Canada Highway 1 Pavement Restoration project within the Glacier National Park. This tender announcement seeks qualified contractors to replace the asphalt structure along the Trans-Canada Highway 1 and restore the pavement to ensure public safety and accessibility through the national park.

## Tender Description
The project involves asphalt pavement removal, replacement, and overlay work, including up to 2 km of ditching. The estimated project value is between $1,000,001 and $5,000,000, with taxes extra. The contractor is responsible for completing the work by August 31, 2023.

## Instructions to Bidders
This tender process consists of two phases: Phase 1, where interested contractors submit their qualifications, and Phase 2, where qualified contractors submit a financial bid. Only Phase 2 bidders will receive an invitation to tender, which will include a technical evaluation component and a pricing component.

## Important Information
* Only bids submitted via fax or email will be accepted. Please use the email address soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca.
* Attachments must be sent as email attachments, not via links.
* Bidders must ensure their email submissions do not exceed 15 MB.
* Late submissions will not be considered.
* Interested contractors must obtain the tender documents from the Government Electronic Tendering Service at www.canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities.

## Contact Information
For technical and contractual questions, please contact the Contracting Authority.

## Requirements
National Parks Regulations require all work to be performed in accordance with the National Park Act ordinances, laws, rules, and regulations.
